    • Method Detail

      • executeQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String connectionUrl,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties,
                              java.lang.String query,
                              QueryParameter... params)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new HelperConnection and executes a new HelperQuery. Useful for when you don't care to keep the HelperConnection or HelperQuery for processing later.
        Parameters:
        connectionUrl - the url to use to create the connection
        properties - the properties to apply to the connection
        query - the query to execute
        params - the parameters to add to the prepared statement created by connection and query
        Returns:
        the results of helperQuery.execute();
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • executeQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(HelperConnection helperConnection,
                              java.lang.String query,
                              QueryParameter... params)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a HelperQuery out of the given HelperConnection, query, and params and calls helperQuery.execute();
        Parameters:
        helperConnection - the HelperConnection to run the query with
        query - the query to be run
        params - the parameters to apply to the statement created by the query and the connection
        Returns:
        the results of helperQuery.execute();
        Throws:
        DataException
        java.sql.SQLException
